Articles.Content:
I'm sure this isn't a new topic - I've seen enough to know there are monoliths/arches on the Mun, easter eggs on Duna, Laythe, Vall, and what not. I even believe there may be pyramids/a UFO on Kerbin.

But nonetheless, I will start with one I did NOT know of - and just recently found out.

I was...well....I was destroying KSC by flinging capsules at buildings.

My maniacal little world of destruction. Watching everything burn...........

Until I noticed a little white thing at the astronaut complex.

It was a toilet.

There is a toilet in the destroyed astronaut complex hanging by a thread on top of a...oh what's the word?

Plumbing! on top of a PLUMBING pipe!

Even better - you can get in this toilet. and derp.

Very silly indeed, Felipe.

So - what have you guys found?
I think you just discovered a new easter egg!

That actually was posted in this thread already: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/95806-25-Easter-Egg-Hunt?highlight=easter+egg+hunt

But yeah, nice new easter egg.
Is this really an Easter egg? I don't want to have any of your eggs

Is this really an Easter egg? I don't want to have any of your eggs

Bahahahahahahaha!

But, slightly seriously, you have to meet some pre-requisites to see it, so I think it deserves to be an easter egg... type thing... like, all the buildings now have their own Biome, but to find this out for yourself, you would have to spend the time walking/roving around... Just because something becomes well-known, doesn't make it less of an easter egg...

To me, an easter egg is something 'extra' in an unexpected place, and possibly not related to the game it's in... like the Doom guy in a secret room in Quake 1 (O.k, that one is slightly related...) but a 'giant' (compared to Kerbals, who seem to use them as jacuzzi's or something!) toilet in a wrecked building, that you can only see by accidentally (or on-purpose) by blowing up one specific building... yeah, that fulfills my definition of 'easter egg' hehe

Even though it has already been mentioned in the other thread, I think it is, um, worthy of it's own thread...

So why do Kerbals have such gigantic toilets, that seem designed for a derriere much bigger than a Kerbal?

Can we deduce the existence of a much bigger form of Kerbal than we've yet seen?

So why do Kerbals have such gigantic toilets, that seem designed for a derriere much bigger than a Kerbal?

Can we deduce the existence of a much bigger form of Kerbal than we've yet seen?

I can't see a toilet - I see ofuro. Ahhh, cultural references are soo difficult with humans, Kerbals, whatever ... (hehe, it's just impossible to say anything, isn't it?)

Ah, so this is why the admin building pool has a different color. Walt needs a HAZMAT suit because he runs the Wastewater Treatment Facility located in the admin building.

KSC Sewers Confirmed!

Not sure if this is an easter-egg, so much as a joke, but I was playing the asteroid grabber tutorial (1st part), when I noticed this...

Confirmed.

To the Kerbals, devs/developers are gods/people with immense power who can change the universe.

(If you wanna check it out, it's near the beginning, just tell Gene to "Continue" and then go to the Map View.) Also, the ship is called Scitest. If this is a reference to anything, please say so, but my gut tells me it's just a temporary name the devs forgot to change.

EDIT: Realised this was a minor necro, but since it's just around a week and it was still on the second page and I was gonna post about this anyways, I figured the mods wouldn't mind.
